Question: When a flock of sheep are coming towards you on a country road, what should you do?

Answers.Answer: Sound the horn on your vehicle to move them out the way
Slow down or pull over to the side of the road
Turn on your vehicle hazard lights and drive on
Drive down the centre of the road

Question: What is shown by a white reflector (cat’s eye) placed on the road?

Answers.Answer: The left side of the road
The far right side of the road

Question: The bonnet of your vehicle lifts up while you are driving and you cannot see. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Turn your vehicle headlights on and look out of the side window
Brake smoothly and move over to the left side of the road
Steer your vehicle straight ahead and stop as quickly as you can

Question: You wish to move your vehicle out of a parking space into the traffic flow. What must you do before you move?

Answers.Answer: Flash your vehicle indicators for 1 second
Signal with your vehicle indicators for at least 3 seconds
Turn on your vehicle parking lights
Use your vehicle brake lights (stop lights)

Question: On a Transit Lane sign, what does T2 mean?

Answers.Answer: Vehicles that use the lane must have at least two people.
Vehicles that use the lane must have two passengers
Only two vehicles are permitted on the transit lane at any time
There are two transit lanes ahead

if the driver has had any crashes
how many times the vehicle has crashed
that the vehicle was roadworthy at the time of checking

Question: For what purpose can a vehicle use the flush median strip?

Answers.Answer: To move into the traffic flow

Question: When coming to a pedestrian crossing with a raised traffic island in the middle, what must you do?

Answers.Answer: Give way to pedestrians who are on your half of the road
Give way to pedestrians on the other side of the road

Question: When passing a horse and rider, what should you do?
